title: Ilness caused by respiratory viruses increases in USA - The Times of India
summary:
Increased Respiratory Virus Illnesses in the USA

Publication Date: Not Available | Source: CDC Update

The US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention reported a rise in illnesses caused by respiratory viruses, predicting further increases with the flu season approaching.

  • Healthcare visits for respiratory viruses are currently at moderate levels.
  • Hospitalizations are expected to be lower compared to last year.
  • COVID-19 and Respiratory Syncytial Virus (RSV) are significantly affecting the population.
  • Recent data shows that influenza A constitutes nearly 97% of positive flu tests.
  • Louisiana and Oregon are reporting high flu case numbers.
  • Of 1,20,000 hospital admissions since October, 72,000 were COVID-related, with 8,200 deaths.
“If a new variant of COVID does not emerge, the burden in hospitals will lower especially during the holiday season.”

The rise in respiratory illnesses highlights the need for continued vigilance as the flu season intensifies and COVID-19 remains a concern.
newTitle: Increased Respiratory Virus Illnesses in the USA

title: GST Council Meeting Highlights: GST exemption for micro and small units renting from unregistered individuals under composition scheme - BusinessLine
summary:
GST Council Meeting Highlights: GST exemption for micro and small units renting from unregistered individuals under composition scheme

Date: December 21, 2024 Source: The Hindu BusinessLine

The GST Council convened its 55th meeting in Jaisalmer, chaired by Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman, addressing significant tax updates.

  • A 5% GST will be applied to ready-to-eat popcorn with salt and spices, provided it is not pre-packaged.
  • 12% GST is set for pre-packaged popcorn and 18% for caramel popcorn.
  • 5% GST is also recommended for fortified rice kernels, regardless of end use.
  • A proposal to revise GST on insurance was deferred for further deliberation.
  • The Council recommended an increase in GST from 12% to 18% for used electric vehicles (EVs) and smaller petrol/diesel cars.
“If these units have rented their premises from individuals who are unregistered, GST will be exempt for them.” - FM Nirmala Sitharaman

This meeting marks a pivotal step in tax reforms aimed at providing relief to micro and small enterprises while adjusting tax policies on various consumer goods.
newTitle: GST Council Meeting Highlights for Micro and Small Units

title: Scientists observe ‘negative time’ in quantum experiments - Macau Business
summary:
Scientists Discover 'Negative Time' in Quantum Mechanics

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Macau Business

Researchers at the University of Toronto have observed a phenomenon they describe as 'negative time,' shedding light on complex interactions between light and matter.

  • The term ‘negative time’ refers to the duration of excited states in atoms being measured as less than zero.
  • Experiments took over two years to optimize and involved lasers and atoms.
  • The findings challenge conventional understanding but do not imply time travel.
  • The research has garnered both skepticism and intrigue within the scientific community.
“We don’t want to say anything traveled backward in time,” said Aephraim Steinberg, a lead researcher.

The discovery highlights the complexities of quantum mechanics and may pave the way for further exploration of light and time.
newTitle: Scientists Discover 'Negative Time' in Quantum Mechanics

title: I thought the tri-folding Huawei Mate XT was a gimmick, but then I held it - TechRadar

Huawei Mate XT: A Tri-Folding Phone That Surprised Me

Source: TechRadar

The Huawei Mate XT is a groundbreaking dual-screen, tri-folding smartphone that has defied initial expectations of being just an expensive gimmick. Its unique design and functionality could redefine the folding phone market.

  • First commercially available tri-folding smartphone.
  • Compact size of 6.4 inches when folded, expands to 10.2 inches fully unfolded.
  • Impressive specifications, including a Kirin 9010 chipset, 16GB RAM, and up to 1TB storage.
  • Strong construction with flexible hinges allowing it to hold positions at various angles.
  • Large battery of 5,600mAh supporting fast charging capabilities.
“Seeing is believing, but feeling is the truth.”

The Mate XT could be a game changer in the foldable market, inspiring future designs from competitors like Samsung. Although currently available only in China, it sets a high standard for foldable technology.
newTitle: Huawei Mate XT: A Tri-Folding Phone That Surprised Me

title: 55th GST council meeting in Jaisalmer on December 21, 2024: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman media briefing - The Hindu
summary:
55th GST Council Meeting Overview: Key Decisions and Updates

Date: December 21, 2024 Source: The Hindu

The 55th meeting of the GST Council, chaired by Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman, was held on December 21, 2024, in Jaisalmer. Several significant discussions on GST changes, including those related to insurance levies, were tabled for future consideration.

  • The review of GST levies on life and health insurance policies was postponed.
  • A Group of Ministers will re-examine the insurance levies prior to making recommendations to the Council.
  • Proposals for rate rationalisation involving about 150 items, such as packaged drinking water and bicycles under ₹10,000, were deferred.
  • The GST on gene therapy and long-range surface to air missiles has been exempted from tax.
  • Used car sales GST increased from 12% to 18%.
  • New tax rates were established for different types of popcorn based on packaging.
  • An examination of GST levies by states hit by natural disasters was initiated.
“Gene therapy that is now critical for dealing with life-threatening diseases, so have been totally exempted [from GST].” - Nirmala Sitharaman

This meeting highlights ongoing efforts to adjust the GST framework to better address various economic needs and situations, while many discussions are still pending for clarity and consensus.
newTitle: 55th GST Council Meeting Overview: Key Decisions and Updates

title: Multistorey building collapses in Punjab’s Mohali, several feared trapped - The Hindu
summary:
Multistorey Building Collapse in Mohali Leaving Several Trapped

Date: December 21, 2024 | Source: PTI

Rescue operations are ongoing after a multistorey building collapsed in Sohana village, Mohali, with fears that people are trapped beneath the debris.

  • The incident occurred on December 21, 2024, according to local sources.
  • District authorities have initiated rescue operations, employing two excavators and a National Disaster Response Team (NDRF) has been dispatched to the site.
  • Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann expressed concern and confirmed that rescue efforts are ongoing, urging cooperation from the public.
  • Preliminary reports suggest the building may have collapsed after excavation work was done nearby.
  • Senior police officials are monitoring the rescue operations, emphasizing the urgency of clearing the debris.
“It is an unfortunate incident. Rescue operation is in full swing.” - Kulwant Singh, Mohali MLA

The situation remains critical as authorities work tirelessly to locate and rescue those potentially trapped under the rubble.
newTitle: Multistorey Building Collapse in Mohali Leaving Several Trapped

title: Pushpa 2 box office day 17 early report: Allu Arjun-starrer just Rs 10 cr away from crossing Baahubali 2’s domestic record, inches away from Rs 1030 cr - The Indian Express
summary:
Pushpa 2 Box Office Day 17 Early Report: Allu Arjun-Starrer Just Rs 10 Cr Away from Crossing Baahubali 2’s Domestic Record

Publication Date: December 2024 | Source: Indian Express

Pushpa 2: The Rule continues to break box office records as it inches closer to overtaking Baahubali 2’s domestic gross. The film has now crossed the Rs 1000 crore mark in India.

  • Pushpa 2 has earned Rs 14.36 crore on its 17th day, with expectations to cross Rs 20 crore over the weekend.
  • The film achieved a total collection of Rs 1020 crore in India till Saturday evening.
  • Pushpa 2 made Rs 264.8 crore in its second week, a 63% drop from its first week.
  • Baahubali 2’s record stands at Rs 1030.42 crore domestically, which Pushpa 2 is projected to surpass soon.
  • The film has a strong occupancy rate of 29.97% for Telugu and 23.6% for Hindi audiences on Day 17.
  • Pushpa 2 has also crossed Rs 1500 crore worldwide within its first 16 days.
“It looks like Pushpa 2 will cross that record soon.”

As the film continues to perform incredibly, its box office journey will be closely monitored, especially with new releases on the horizon.
newTitle: Pushpa 2 Box Office Surges Towards Record Breaking Figures

title: Building collapses in Punjab's Mohali, several feared trapped - Hindustan Times
summary:
Building collapses in Punjab's Mohali, several feared trapped

Date: Dec 21, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

A multi-storey building in Mohali collapsed, with several people feared trapped under the debris. Emergency services are currently engaged in rescue operations.

  • A multi-storey building collapsed in Mohali, Punjab.
  • District authorities have launched a rescue operation with two excavators and a fire brigade present.
  • A loud noise was reported at the time of the collapse.
  • Causal factors are being investigated, particularly concerning basement excavation nearby.
  • Police and NDRF teams are on-site, and efforts are underway to rescue the trapped individuals.
  • Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann is coordinating with the administration and the rescue teams.
“We pray that there is no loss of life, we will also take action against the culprits.” - Bhagwant Mann

The incident has raised concerns about safety protocols in construction and ongoing rescue efforts are crucial for those potentially trapped.

Poll Rules Tweak Makes Electronic Records Harder To Get, Sparks Row - NDTV
summary:
Poll Rules Tweak Makes Electronic Records Harder To Get, Sparks Row

Publication Date: Recent

Source: NDTV

The government has amended election rules to limit public access to certain electronic records, which has raised concerns about transparency in the electoral process.

  • The amendment prevents public inspection of electronic records like CCTV footage and webcasting from polling stations.
  • Officials argue the change is necessary to prevent misuse and protect voter secrecy.
  • Opposition parties claim the amendment erodes the integrity of the electoral process.
  • A court case prompted the amendment, emphasizing the need for clarity regarding what documents are available for public inspection.
  • The amendment only allows access to documents explicitly mentioned in election rules.
“If there was ever a vindication of our assertions regarding the rapidly eroding integrity of the electoral process managed by the Election Commission of India (ECI) in recent times, this is it.” - Jairam Ramesh

This amendment has sparked considerable debate about the balance between election security and public transparency.
newTitle: Poll Rules Tweak Makes Electronic Records Harder To Get, Sparks Row

title: Ghazanfar five-for leads Afghanistan to ODI series win over below-par Zimbabwe - ESPNcricinfo
summary:
Afghanistan Secures ODI Series Win Over Zimbabwe with Ghazanfar's Five-Wicket Haul

Date: October 2023 | Source: ESPN Cricinfo

Afghanistan defeated Zimbabwe by eight wickets in the third ODI match, clinching the series 2-0 after the first match was washed out.

Key highlights from the match include:

  • Zimbabwe scored 127 runs in 30.1 overs, with Sean Williams top-scoring at 60 runs.
  • AM Ghazanfar took 5 wickets for 33 runs, marking his second ODI five-for.
  • Sediqullah Atal contributed significantly with the bat, scoring 52 runs off 50 balls.
  • This marks Afghanistan's sixth consecutive ODI series win against Zimbabwe.
“Afghanistan’s bowlers proved the decision right with impressive bowling figures.”

Afghanistan's comprehensive victory underscores their dominance against Zimbabwe in ODI series history.
newTitle: Afghanistan Secures ODI Series Win Over Zimbabwe with Ghazanfar's Five-Wicket Haul

title: "After 'Pushpa 2' Stampede, Actor Said Film Will Be A Hit": Telangana MLA - NDTV
summary:
Telangana MLA Criticizes Actor After 'Pushpa 2' Stampede Incident

Publication Date: December 8, 2023 | Source: NDTV

Telangana MLA Akbaruddin Owaisi raised concerns regarding an actor's behavior following a tragic incident at the premiere of 'Pushpa 2', where a woman died during a stampede.

  • A 35-year-old woman died during a stampede at the Sandhya Theatre on December 4.
  • The incident occurred as fans rushed to see actor Allu Arjun at the 'Pushpa 2: The Rule' premiere.
  • Owaisi claimed that the actor commented that the film will now be a hit after the incident.
  • The actor, whose name was not mentioned by Owaisi, was seen waving to fans after the stampede.
  • Police registered a case against the actor, his security team, and theatre management after the incident.
  • The Chief Minister criticized the lack of empathy shown by film personalities towards the victim's family.
“Sir, I remember once my security official's cap had fallen down while protecting me. He had to do his duty... But here you see, Sir, a woman dies, two small children were caught in the stampede...” - Akbaruddin Owaisi

The MLA's comments have sparked a debate on celebrity responsibility and crowd management during public events, especially following a tragic incident that resulted in loss of life.
newTitle: Telangana MLA Criticizes Actor After 'Pushpa 2' Stampede Incident

The suspect behind the deadly Christmas market attack in Magdeburg, Germany, has been identified as 50-year-old Taleb A. He reportedly rammed his BMW into a crowded market, resulting in five fatalities and over 200 injuries.

  • The attacker, Taleb A., has lived in Germany for almost 20 years.
  • Germany's interior minister stated that the suspect is an 'Islamophobe'.

title: People feared trapped after multi-storey building collapses in Punjab’s Mohali - The Indian Express
summary:
Multi-storey building collapses in Mohali, Army fears 10-15 trapped in basement

Date: Saturday evening, Source: Indian Express

A multi-storey building collapsed in the Sohana area of Mohali, Punjab, raising concerns that several individuals may be trapped beneath the debris.

  • The building collapsed after excavation work for a nearby basement.
  • The Army has sent two engineering columns to assist in rescue efforts.
  • Estimates suggest that 10-15 people could be trapped in the basement.
  • Rescue operations are ongoing, with local police present at the scene.
  • The local former sarpanch reported that a gym was damaged at the time of the collapse.
“As of now, we do not know what has happened. We are looking if anyone is trapped and urge the administration to expedite the rescue work.” - Parwinder Singh Sohana, former sarpanch

The situation remains critical as the rescue team continues to search for survivors beneath the rubble.
newTitle: Multi-storey building collapses in Mohali, Army fears 10-15 trapped in basement
